title: 'The most wonderful human' - Greenwood leads support for Moody after MND diagnosis
summary: Friend and former team-mate Will Greenwood backs Lewis Moody after the ex-England captain reveals he has motor neurone disease.

title: Brits century helps SA respond to England crushing
summary: Tazmin Brits' sublime century helps South Africa bounce back from their heavy defeat by England with a six-wicket win over New Zealand in the Women's World Cup.

title: Is Martin worst Rangers boss ever? What do the numbers say?
summary: BBC Scotland crunches the numbers behind Russell Martin's calamitous four-month tenure and looks at who Rangers could turn to next.

title: Norrie out in Shanghai Masters third round
summary: Britain's Cameron Norrie is left to rue missed opportunities as he is beaten by rising teenage star Learner Tien in the Shanghai Masters third round.

title: Depay late for Dutch duty after passport stolen
summary: Netherlands forward Memphis Depay will be late for international duty because his passport was stolen in Brazil, where he plays for Corinthians.

title: Scrutiny on us can only be good - England's Dean
summary: Spinner Charlie Dean reflects on the increased scrutiny England faced after a difficult winter and looks ahead to their second World Cup game against Bangladesh.

title: Red Roses winning back-to-back World Cups is RFU growth goal
summary: The Rugby Football Union has challenged the Red Roses to become the first England team to defend a Rugby World Cup as part of its women's game growth strategy.

title: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS may come from the mysterious frontier of the early Milky Way, new study hints
summary: The interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS does not come from our corner of the Milky Way, and may be a time capsule of the early galaxy, new research into its trajectory hints.

title: MCC explains controversial Pakistan run-out call
summary: Cricket's lawmakers explain why the umpires eventually made the correct decision in deeming Muneeba Ali to have been run out in Pakistan's defeat by India.

title: Wolvaardt's 'outstanding' catch to dismiss Tahuhu
summary: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt produces an "outstanding" catch to dismiss New Zealand's Lea Tahuhu in their ICC Women's Cricket World Cup match in Indore.

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah

summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

summary: This is the story of England defender Lucy Bronze, who is no stranger to winning and hopes for more success at Euro 2025.
